wikipedia_page.main:
George Neville Hudson (12 July 1905 – 24 November 1981) was an English cricketer. Hudson's batting style is unknown, though it is known he was a right-arm slow bowler.  He was born at Clitheroe, Lancashire.
Hudson made two first-class appearances for Lancashire in 1936, one in the County Championship against Derbyshire, and another against the touring Indians. His brief first-class career yielded a single run, and no wickets from 25 overs bowled. He later played club cricket for Bacup in the Lancashire League from 1946–48.He died at Preston, Lancashire on 24 November 1981.
